item.title: SHarmonic: A fast and accurate implementation of spherical harmonics for electronic-structure calculations
item.description: arXiv:2510.05282v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: The authors present SHarmonic, a new implementation of the spherical harmonics targeted for electronic-structure calculations. Their approach is to use explicit formulas for the harmonics written in terms of normalized Cartesian coordinates. This approach results in a code that is as precise as other implementations while being at least one order of magnitude more computationally efficient. The library can run on graphics processing units (GPUs) as well, achieving an additional order of magnitude in execution speed. This new implementation is simple to use and is provided under an open source license, it can be readily used by other codes to avoid the error-prone and cumbersome implementation of the spherical harmonics.
item.dc:creator: Xavier Andrade, Jacopo Simoni, Yuan Ping, Tadashi Ogitsu, Alfredo A. Correa

item.title: Growing Mathlib: maintenance of a large scale mathematical library
item.description: arXiv:2508.21593v2 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: The Lean mathematical library Mathlib is one of the fastest-growing libraries of formalised mathematics. We describe various strategies to manage this growth, while allowing for change and avoiding maintainer overload. This includes dealing with breaking changes via a deprecation system, using code quality analysis tools (linters) to provide direct user feedback about common pitfalls, speeding up compilation times through conscious library (re-)design, dealing with technical debt as well as writing custom tooling to help with the review and triage of new contributions.
item.dc:creator: Anne Baanen, Matthew Robert Ballard, Johan Commelin, Bryan Gin-ge Chen, Michael Rothgang, Damiano Testa
